block.p: The General Electric Company reported a 17.7 percent gain in third-quarter earnings yesterday.

Earnings for the quarter rose to $1.61 billion, or 96 cents a share, in line with analysts' estimates, on revenues of $17.34 billion. A year earlier it earned $1.37 billion, or 80 cents a share, on revenues of $14.63 billion.
The General Electric Company reported a 17.7 percent gain in third-quarter earnings yesterday.

Earnings for the quarter rose to $1.61 billion, or 96 cents a share, in line with analysts' estimates, on revenues of $17.34 billion. A year earlier it earned $1.37 billion, or 80 cents a share, on revenues of $14.63 billion.
G.E., based in Fairfield, Conn., makes aircraft engines, power systems, light bulbs and appliances. It has a financial unit and is the owner of NBC.
The company said its earnings from continuing operations rose to 96 cents a share from 85 cents a year earlier.
It added that GE Capital, NBC and its plastics operations all achieved double-digit increases.
Operating margins in the quarter were 13.4 percent, up from 12.8 percent a year earlier.
